title: Program Manager for Data Scientist Interns (Sr. Data Scientist)

description:
Overview

State Farm is seeking an experienced data scientist with a passion for mentoring others to serve as the primary technical lead of the Modeling & Graduate Network (MAGNet) internship program, a primary pipeline for data science talent at State Farm. The individual selected for this role will have the chance to expand both their technical & leadership skills by overseeing the day-to-day operation of the MAGNet program based in Champaign, IL in cooperation with The University of Illinois Urbana-Champaign (U of I). The key responsibilities of this individual are hiring & developing graduate students working as year-round, State Farm MAGNet interns. These interns are tasked with solving applied data science problems at State Farm. In addition, the MAGNet lead will work closely with the MAGNet programs at our two other locations to source & scope project work for the MAGNet interns and will serve as State Farm’s liaison between its data science community & the partnering graduate programs at U of I.
Outside of the responsibilities of the MAGNet operation, the individual selected for this role will contribute to the development of AI/ML educational materials, intended for a variety of internal audiences.

What’s In it For You?:
• Mentoring: this role provides a great opportunity to make an impact & positively influence the careers of aspiring data scientists
• Leadership: you will have the opportunity to lead U of I MAGNet, with responsibilities including, but not limited to: recruiting, hiring, development of others, project scoping, project management & communication of outcomes to senior leadership
• Personal Development: MAGNet projects are scoped to be one semester in duration, so you’ll have the chance to get hands-on experience with a wide variety of AI/ML use cases that span multiple business areas & advanced analytic techniques

Work Arrangement:

Hybrid: arrangement based out of State Farm Research and Development Center at Research Park in Champaign, IL

Competencies:

Technical Expertise

Critical Thinking

Teamwork

Initiative

Resourcefulness

Communication

Mentorship

We are not just offering a job but a meaningful career! Come join our passionate team!

As a Fortune 50 company, we hire the best employees to serve our customers, making us a leader in the insurance and financial services industry. State Farm embraces diversity and inclusion to ensure a workforce that is engaged, builds on the strengths and talents of all associates, and creates a Good Neighbor culture.

We offer competitive benefits and pay with the potential for an annual financial award based on both individual and enterprise performance. Our employees have an opportunity to participate in volunteer events within the community and engage in a learning culture. We offer programs to assist with tuition reimbursement, professional designations, employee development, wellness initiatives, and more!

Visit our Careers page for more information on our benefits, locations and the process of joining the State Farm team!

Additional Benefits:

• Competitive benefits, pay and bonus potential
• Volunteer opportunities
• Continuing education support
• A learning culture: mentoring, professional designations, employee development, and more
• We embrace Diversity and Inclusion: we are one team, and it is simply the right thing to do

Learn more about our benefits at State Farm Careers!

Responsibilities

Individual responsibilities may vary by role.

Qualifications

Qualifications We Look For:

• Completed Masters, other advanced degrees, in an analytical field such as statistics, economics, data science, mathematics, quantitative marketing, operations research, etc.
• A minimum of 4 years of applied experience developing predictive models in an industry setting
• Experience with gathering and interpreting business requirements to design and create scalable data science solutions in a regulatory environment (including, but not limited to, insurance, healthcare, and finance).
• Experience serving as mentor/coach of junior data scientists and/or interns is strongly preferred
• Experience managing multiple technical projects simultaneously
• Broad experience with a variety of advanced modeling techniques: generalized linear & non-linear modeling, survival analysis, clustering, time series, tree-based algorithms, and/or neural networks.
• Familiarity with concepts related to the design of experiments & the analysis of unstructured data
• Proficiency with Python, R and/or SAS
• Familiarity with cloud-based environments (e.g., AWS)
• Demonstrated ability to convey complex subject matter to a variety of audiences
